--- title: "4.4 — The Keynesian Revolution — Class Content" execute: freeze: auto --- ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} # Meeting Dates *Tuesday, November 29, 2022* ::: ## Overview ## Readings ### Required Readings - “Keynesian Macroeconomics” in Ch.15 "The Development of Modern Macroeconomic Thought" in Landreth & Colander ### Recommended Readings: - [ NPR's *Planet Money*: "The Invention of the Economy"](https://www.npr.org/sections/money/2014/03/05/286366404/episode-521-the-invention-of-the-economy) - [ Keynes, 1936, *The General Theory of Employment, Interest and Money*](https://www.marxists.org/reference/subject/economics/keynes/general-theory/) ### Helpful: - [ John Maynard Keynes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Maynard_Keynes) - [ The General Theory of Employment, Interest and Money](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_General_Theory_of_Employment,_Interest_and_Money) - [ Keynesian Revolution](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Keynesian_Revolution) - [ Keynesian economics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Keynesian_Revolutionhttps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Keynesian_economics) ### Questions to Help Your Reading ## Slides Below, you can find the slides in two formats. Clicking the image will bring you to the html version of the slides in a new tab. The lower button will allow you to download a PDF version of the slides. ::: callout-tip You can type h to see a special list of viewing options, and type o for an outline view of all the slides. ::: I suggest printing the slides beforehand and using them to take additional notes in class (*not everything* is in the slides)!

Download as PDF

## Assignments ### Participation/Discussion Board Posts Due 8 PM Fri Dec 2 This week's graded discussion is worth 5 points, and can be a combination of discussion in class, and/or posts on the Blackboard Discussion Board by 8 PM this Friday December 2. ## Tournament Votes The first round of the Neoclassical division of the "Most Interesting Economist in History" tournament is live. Please post your votes in the discussion board.
